column5: Decided to try the famous lake Erie jumbo perch when the eyes were not cooperating today.  Double headers, mixed doubles, huge pigs....waooo...I do a lot of Lake Simcoe perching in the fall and some in winter but those Erie perch are something else. Now I kind of understand the locals obsession with perching vs. eyes or bows on Erie...42 fow, minnows were the most desired menu.          After such a busy day on the water someone mentioned the word "beach" on the way back...so we had to stop there for some water fun, followed by visits to the burger and ice cream shops....    All that made for a happy crew on the return trip home ha ha ha  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Awesome.  The ice cream industry on the North shore of Eastern Lake Erie is booming!!!   Well done.
looks like a very succesful outing. Say "Hi" to Jordan for me.
What a super day on the water Emil.  Looks like you and the kids had a great day  What time is the perch fry?
Way to go Emil!!  Have to love Erie...rainbows, big eyes AND tons of jumbo perch! Looks like you guys had an awesome day!!
AWESOME - love the fact that you let them hit the beach for a minute!  Thanks for the post  cheers, Ryan
Those are awesome perch congrats!!! Mind if I ask what Port you left from?
Nice "Cooler of Death" there Emil. Never fished Erie for perch. It looks like I'm missing out. A cooler of tasty fish and a nice refreshing swim to end the day. Thx for sharing that with us
With a nice cooler of Perch like that, Who would ever want to eat a Lake erie hog Walleye. Nice cooler of Perch and to top it off having the kids out to enjoy.
We launched at Burwell, but the spot was ....well in the middle of nowhere....about 17 miles run....well worth it though ;-)  Cheers, Ice Fisherman

Thats great...bet the kids had a blast too. I have just introduced my young lad to perch fishing...he would have loved that.  He would have loved the swim after too....then ice cream too!?  Good job dad!
Hey Ice  A lot of 'Fish and Chips' in that cooler!!  Looks like the Crew is having some Fun!  Good for You  Rick
I need to launch the tinny off the beach!
